document.masterDocTitle: The type specimens of Papilionoidea in the collection of the National Museum of Natural History, Sofia (Lepidoptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The type specimens of Papilionoidea in the collection of the National Museum of Natural History, Sofia (Lepidoptera)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: National Museum of Natural History, Bulgarian Academy of Sciences, 1 Tsar Osvoboditel Blvd, 1000 Sofia, Bulgaria & https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 9106 - 1754
National Museum of Natural History, Bulgarian Academy of Sciences, 1 Tsar Osvoboditel Blvd, 1000 Sofia, Bulgaria

subSubSection.paragraph:
“
Erebia cassioides centrorilica
ssp. nova ” ( Abadjiev 2001b: 58–63 , Figs 2 , 3, 6, 8, 10 , 13 ). Type locality: “ Bulgaria : [Central] Rila Mts: [SW slope of] Suha Vapa [Peak]: 2450 m ”, originally designated ( Abadjiev 2001b: 58 ).
Paratypes 21 ♂♂ , 4 ♀♀ with labels:

2200 m
|
13.VIII.1998
| S. Abadjiev leg. | [line] S. Abadjiev coll. 1277”; (1) printed (on red paper), double framed “ PARATYPE ♂ [1] | Erebia cas- sioides | centrorilica | subsp. nov. | [line] | S. Abadjiev det 2000”; (1) printed (on white paper) “NMNHS- INV-T-01059”
;

Additional types exist in the collections of Muséum d’Histoire naturelle, Geneva (especially the holotype ♂ ) and Institute of Biodiversity and Ecosystem Research , Bulgarian Academy of Sciences , Sofia . Valid subspecies of
Erebia neleus (Freyer, 1832) ( Wiemers et al. 2018 )
, endemic for the alpine part of Rila Mountains , Bulgaria
.
